tuv.seg: Immigration rules for full-time non-EEA students
Rialacha inimirce do mhic léinn lánaimseartha neamh-LEE
Non-EEA nationals coming to study in Ireland must be enrolled in an eligible full-time course
Ní mór do náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE atá ag teacht chun staidéar a dhéanamh in Éirinn, bheith cláraithe i gcúrsa lánaimseartha incháilithe
There have been several changes to the immigration rules for non-EEA students in 2015 and 2016 – see below
Bhí roinnt athraithe ar na rialacha inimirce do mhic léinn neamh-LEE i 2015 agus 2016 – féach thíos
A list of frequently asked questions for non-EEA students is available on the website of the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS), inis.gov.ie
Tá liosta ceisteanna coitianta do mhic léinn neamh-LEE ar fáil ar an láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (SEIÉ), inis.gov.ie
Students who are from a country that requires a visa to enter Ireland, must apply for a student visa
Caithfidh mic léinn ó thír a dteastaíonn víosa uathu chun teacht isteach go hÉirinn cur isteach ar víosa mac léinn
Their visa application must include evidence that they have access to €7,000 when they come to Ireland
Caithfidh a n-iarratas víosa fianaise a chuimsigh go bhfuil rochtain ar €7,000 acu nuair tagann siad in Éirinn
All non-EEA students, including those who do not require a visa, must register with their local immigration officer to get permission to remain in Ireland for more than 90 days
Caithfidh gach mac léinn neamh-LEE, ina n-áirítear iad siúd nach dteastaíonn víosa uathu, clárú leis an oifigeach inimirce áitiúil chun cead a fháil fanacht in Éirinn níos mó ná 90 lá
Students who do not require a visa must have €3,000 when they first register with their local immigration officer, if they are coming to study for more than 6 months
Má tá siad ag déanamh staidéar ar feadh 6 mhí nó níos mó, ní mór do mhic léinn nach dteastaíonn víosa uathu €3,000 a bheith acu chun clárú leis an oifigeach inimirce áitiúil don chéad uair
A number of measures based on the policy statement, Reform of the International Education System and Student Immigration Sector (pdf) have been implemented
Tá roinnt beart bunaithe ar an ráiteas beartas, Athchóiriú ar an gCóras Oideachais Idirnáisiúnta agus ar Earnáil Inimirce na Mac Léinn (pdf) á gcur i bhfeidhm
• Since 1 January 2015, standardisation of the working year for the concession that allows non-EEA students to work – see 'Work' below
• Ón 1 Eanáir 2015, caighdeánú ar an mbliain oibre don lamháltas a cheadaíonn do mhic léinn nach mic léinn LEE iad a bheith ag obair – féach 'Obair' thíos
• Since 20 January 2016, an updated Interim List of Eligible Programmes (ILEP) for student immigration purposes, made up of:
• Ón 20 Eanáir 2016, Liosta Eatramhaigh de Chláir Incháilithe (ILEP) nuashonraithe chun críocha inimirce mac léinn, comhdhéanta de:

□ Higher education programmes: in general (with some exceptions) restricted to programmes accredited by Irish awarding bodies or those accredited by certain EU universities - see 'Higher education programmes' below

□ Cláir ardoideachais: teoranta go ginearálta (le roinnt eisceachtaí) do chláir arna gcreidiúnú ag comhlachtaí dámhachtana Éireannacha nó iad siúd arna gcreidiúnú ag ollscoileanna áirithe an AE – féach ‘Cláir ardoideachais’ thíos
□ English-language programmes: The ILEP is the only list of recognised programmes for student immigration purposes – see ‘English-language programmes’ below
□ Cláir Bhéarla: tá an ILEP ar an aon liosta clár aitheanta chun críocha inimirce mac léinn – féach ‘Cláir Bhéarla’ thíos
• Since 21 January 2016, the immigration permission to attend a 25-week English-language course is reduced from 12 months to 8 months
• Ón 21 Eanáir 2016, laghdóidh an cead inimirce freastal ar chúrsa Béarla 25 seachtaine ó 12 mí go dtí 8 mí
• All private providers on the ILEP have to meet additional requirements, including learner protection and a separate accounts facility to safeguard student advance payments
• Tá ar gach soláthraí príobháideach ar an ILEP riachtanais bhreise a bhaint amach, lena n-áirítear cosaint foghlaimeora agus áis chuntais ar leith chun réamhíocaíochtaí mac léinn a chosaint
• There will be an enhanced inspection and compliance regime in order to monitor educational quality and immigration compliance
• Cuirfear córas iniúchta agus comhlíonta feabhsaithe i bhfeidhm d’fhonn monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar cháilíocht oideachais agus ar chomhlíonadh inimirce
Closure of private colleges: The website studenttaskforce.ie provides information for students affected by the closure of private colleges
Coláistí príobháideacha a dhúnadh: Soláthraíonn an suíomh gréasáin studenttaskforce.ie faisnéis do mhic léinn a bhí thíos leis nuair a dúnadh roinnt coláistí príobháideacha
INIS has advised students applying to alternative colleges to obtain written details of the college’s Learner Protection arrangements
Cuireann INIS comhairle ar mhic léinn atá ag déanamh iarratas ar choláistí eile sonraí scríofa a fháil de shocruithe Cosanta Foghlaimeora an choláiste
The Irish Council for International Students has published information about Learner Protection
D’fhoilsigh an Chomhairle do Mhic Léinn Idirnáisiúnta in Éirinn eolas faoi Chosaint Foghlaimeora
Non-EEA nationals coming to study in Ireland must be enrolled in a full-time course in one of the following categories
Caithfidh gach mac léinn neamh-LEE atá ag teacht chun staidéar a dhéanamh in Éirinn a bheith cláraithe i gcúrsa lánaimseartha i gceann den 2 chatagóir seo a leanas
They are not allowed to come to Ireland to do a part-time or distance learning course
Níl cead ag mic léinn neamh-LEE teacht go hÉirinn chun cúrsa páirtaimseartha nó cianfhoghlama a dhéanamh
Since 1 June 2015, non-EEA nationals can enrol in an eligible course at level 6 or above on the National Framework of Qualifications (NFQ)
Ón 1 Meitheamh 2015, féadfaidh náisiúnaithe nach náisiúnaithe LEE iad clárú i gcúrsa incháilithe ag leibhéal 6 nó níos airde ar an gCreat Náisiúnta Cáilíochtaí (NFQ)
Eligible courses are listed on the updated Interim List of Eligible Programmes (ILEP)
Tá cúrsaí incháilithe liostaithe ar an gcéad Liosta Eatramhach de Chláir Incháilithe (ILEP)
The maximum time they can study in Ireland at this level is 7 years
Is é an t-uasmhéid ama ar féidir leo staidéar a dhéanamh ag an leibhéal seo ná 7 mbliana
There are exceptions to this limit for students doing a Ph.D or a course such as medicine and for students in special circumstances such as illness
Tá eisceachtaí don teorainn seo do mhic léinn a bhfuil dochtúireacht ar siúl acu nó cúrsa ar nós leigheas agus do mhic léinn a bhfuil cúinsí speisialta acu, ar nós tinneas
Students must have a certain standard of English
Caithfidh mic léinn caighdeán áirithe Béarla a bheith acu
They must also prove that they are progressing in the course, for example, passing exams
Ní féidir le mic léinn athrú ón gClár Céime chuig an gClár Teanga agus Neamh-Chéim

INIS has published Guidelines for Degree Programme Students (pdf), listing immigration requirements for students on higher education programmes, including the requirement to have medical insurance (pdf)

Tá sonraí an chláir, cosúil leis an ngá le hárachas leighis (pdf) agus riachtanais eile inimirce liostaithe i dTreoirlínte do Mhic léinn Clár Céime (pdf) atá foilsithe ar shuíomh gréasáin na Seirbhíse Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (SEIÉ)
Third Level Graduate Scheme: When they graduate, students may get an extension of their permission to remain in Ireland under the Third Level Graduate Scheme (pdf)
Scéim Chéimithe Tríú Leibhéal: Nuair a chéimníonn mic léinn, is féidir leo síneadh a fháil ar a gcead fanachta in Éirinn faoin Scéim Chéimithe Tríú Leibhéal (pdf)
The scheme allows them to find employment and apply for a General Employment Permit or Critical Skills Employment Permit
Ligeann an scéim dóibh fostaíocht a lorg agus iarratas ar Chead Fostaíochta Scileanna Criticiúla nó Cead Fostaíochta Ginearálta a dhéanamh
Graduates with a level 7 qualification may get a 6-month extension to their residence permission
is féidir le céimithe le cáilíocht Leibhéal 7 síneadh 6 mhí a fháil ar a gcead cónaithe
Graduates with qualifications at levels 8-10 may get a 12-month extension to their permission
Is féidir le céimithe le cáilíochtaí ag leibhéil 8-10 síneadh 12 mí a fháil ar a gceadú
If they are granted permission to remain, from 1 February 2016 they will get stamp 1G
Má fhaigheann siad cead fanacht, gheobhaidh siad stampa 1G ó 1 Feabhra 2016
Since 20 January 2016, eligible English-language courses are listed in the updated Interim List of Eligible Programmes (ILEP)
Ón 20 Eanáir 2016, tá cúrsaí Béarla incháilithe liostaithe sa Liosta Eatramhach de Chláir Incháilithe (ILEP) nuashonraithe
Further education programmes and overseas-accredited vocational education and training programmes are no longer listed as eligible courses and the Internationalisation Register has ceased to exist
Ní liostaítear cláir bhreisoideachais agus cláir ghairmoideachais agus oiliúna arna gcreidiúnú thar lear mar chúrsaí incháilithe a thuilleadh agus níl ann don Chlár Idirnáisiúnaithe a thuilleadh
The immigration permission to attend a 25-week English-language course is for 8 months (was 12 months)
Tá an cead inimirce freastal ar chúrsa Béarla 25 seachtaine 8 mí (12 mí roimhe seo)
This applies to first-time and renewal registrations with effect from 21 January 2016
Baineann sé le cláraithe nua agus athnuachana ón 21 Eanáir 2016
Existing permissions are not affected. New students attending language courses may be granted permission for a maximum of 3 language courses
D’fhéadfadh mic léinn nua ag freastal cúrsaí teanga cead inimirce ar feadh uasmhéid 3 bhliain a fháil
This amounts to a total immigration permission of 2 years (3 x 8 months)
Is ionann an cead inimirce seo agus 2 bhliain iomlán (3 x 8 mí)
INIS has published an overview of conditions for language programme students listing immigration requirements for such students
Tá sonraí riachtanais inimirce eile liostaithe san fhorbhreathnú forálacha do mhac léinn clár teanga atá foilsithe ag an tSeirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann
Students registered before 1 January 2011
Mic léinn atá cláraithe roimh 1 Eanáir 2011
There are specific arrangements for non-EEA students who were registered in Ireland before 1 January 2011 (pdf)
Tá socruithe sonracha do mhic léinn neamh-LEE atá cláraithe in Éirinn roimh 1 Eanáir 2011 (pdf)
Probationary extension: From 28 August 2012 to 26 February 2013 certain non-EEA national students resident in Ireland since before 1 January 2005 were granted a special Student Probationary Extension
Síneadh promhaidh: Ón 28 Lúnasa 2012 go dtí an 26 Feabhra 2013, Síneadh Promhaidh speisialta mac léinn do mhic léinn áirithe neamh-LEE a bhí ina gcónaí in Éirinn roimh an 1 Eanáir 2005
They got a stamp 2 permission for 2 years followed by a temporary six-month Stamp 4 permission
Tugadh cead stampa 2 dóibh ar feadh 2 bhliain agus ina dhiaidh sin, cead stampa 4 sealadach ar feadh 6 mhí
Then, after an application procedure, eligible students were granted a stamp 4 permission to remain in Ireland
Ansin, tar éis nós imeachta iarratais, deonaíodh stampa 4 cead fanachta in Éirinn do mhic léinn incháilithe
Students may not change course during the first year of study
Ní féidir le mic léinn cúrsa a athrú i rith na chéad bhliana den staidéar
After that they may be allowed to change to another course, provided it is at the same or a higher level
Ina dhiaidh sin, d’fhéadfaí go mbeadh cead acu athrú chuig cúrsa eile, ar an tuisicint go bhfuil an leibhéal mar an gcéanna nó níos airde
They may not change from a full-time to a part-time course
Ní féidir leo athrú ó chúrsa lánaimseartha go cúrsa páirtaimseartha
Non-EEA students with Stamp 2 permission to remain are allowed to take up casual employment
Tá cead ag mic léinn neamh-LEE le ceadúnas fanachta Stampa 2 fostaíocht ócáideach a thógáil
They can work up to 20 hours a week during term time and up to 40 hours a week in the holidays
Féadfaidh siad oibriú suas go dtí 20 uair sa tseachtain i rith am téarma agus suas go dtí 40 uair in aghaidh na seachtaine sa tsaoire
Holiday periods have been standardised – June to September inclusive and from 15 December to 15 January
Ón 1 Eanáir 2015, ní féidir le mic léinn a bhfuil stampa 2 acu oibriú ach 40 uair sa tseachtain idir Meitheamh agus Meán Fómhair, an mhí sin san áireamh, agus idir an 15 Nollaig agus an 15 Eanáir
Since 1 September 2016 there are changes to the rules allowing non-EEA students to work
Ó 1 Meán Fómhair 2016 tá athruithe ar na rialacha a cheadaíonn mic léinn neamh-LEE a oibriú
Students with stamp 2A permission are not allowed to work
Níl cead ag mic léinn a bhfuil ceadúnas Stampa 2A acu oibriú
Non-EEA students are not entitled to social welfare payments
Níl mic léinn neamh-LEE i dteideal íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh in Éirinn
One of the conditions of their residence permission is that they have enough money to support themselves and live in Ireland without claiming State benefits
Is é coinníoll a gcead cónaithe go bhfuil dóthain airgid acu chun iad féin a thacú agus bheith ina gcónaí in Éirinn gan iarratas ar shochair Stáit a dhéanamh
As a general rule non-EEA students coming to Ireland have no right to bring their family with them
Mar riail ghinearálta, níl aon chead ag mic léinn neamh-LEE atá ag teacht go hÉirinn a dteaghlach a thabhairt leo
Spouses, partners and children of non-EEA nationals can apply to enter and live in Ireland in their own right, but they cannot apply on the basis of their relationship to a non-EEA student

Is féidir le céilí, páirtithe agus leanaí de náisiúnaithe neamh-LEE cur isteach ar iontráil agus cónaí in Éirinn ina gceart féin, ach ní féidir leo cur isteach air ar bhunús a gcaidrimh le mac léinn neamh-LEE
There are some exceptions to this rule, for example, for Ph.D. students or for students who can prove they have sufficient funds to support their family
Tá roinnt eisceachtaí ar an riail seo, mar shampla, do mhic léinn dochtúireachta nó do mhic léinn ar féidir leo a chruthú go bhfuil a ndóthain maoine acu tacú lena dteaghlach
In addition there are transitional arrangements for the children of non-EEA students who were already in Ireland on 1 January 2011 (pdf)
Maille leis sin tá socruithe idirthréimhseacha do leanaí mhic léinn neamh-LEE a raibh in Éirinn ar an 1 Eanáir 2011 (pdf)
Short-stay language courses and semesters
Cúrsaí teanga agus seimeastair ghearrfhanachta
There are special arrangements for non-EEA students coming to Ireland to do a short English language course (pdf)
Chomh maith leis an dá chlár thuas tá socruithe speisialta do mhic léinn neamh-LEE atá ag teacht go hÉirinn chun cúrsa gearr Béarla a dhéanamh (pdf)
The course must be for less than 90 days
Caithfidh go mbeidh an cúrsa seo níos giorra ná 90 lá
There are also specific immigration requirements for non-EEA students coming to study for a semester (pdf)
Tá riachtanais speisialta inimirce do mhic léinn neamh-LEE ag teacht chun staidéar ar feadh seimeastair (pdf)
